newsitem.title: USA: James River closes $372 mln unit sale.
newsitem.headline: James River closes $372 mln unit sale.

text.p: James River Corp said on Thursday it completed the sale of its Flexible Packaging group to Printpack Inc, a privately-held manufacturer of flexible packaging headquartered in Atlanta, for $372 million.
The company expects to record a gain of between $.15 and $.20 per share in the third quarter related to this divestiture, JAmes River said.
Included in the sale were ten manufacturing facilities which were formerly part of James River's Packaging Business, the company said.
On a combined basis, these facilities had sales of approximately $490 million in 1995 and employ 2,200 people, James River said.
About $200 million of the proceeds will be temporarily invested and then used to complete the early September purchase of the remaining 14 percent minority interest in Jamont NV, James River said.
Remaining proceeds will be used to reduce debt to improve financial flexibility, James River said.
